topic_metadata.title: How to make abbreviations containing period inseparable?

posts.name: Michael Yang
posts.cooked:
Currently when writing abbreviations such as “e.g.” and “i.e.”, typst treats them as separate sentences, and adds spaces and breaks them across lines as necessary, for example:

image785×73 27.9 KB

There is a feature request for this issue, to add something similar to \@ in Latex. Is there any workaround for this issue in 0.12? Thanks!
posts.raw:
Currently when writing abbreviations such as "e.g." and "i.e.", typst treats them as separate sentences, and adds spaces and breaks them across lines as necessary, for example:

![image|690x64, 100%](upload://pTEjqUIFx24MVsPBNiFM0nWmygP.png)

There is a feature request for this [issue](https://github.com/typst/typst/issues/1281), to add something similar to `\@` in Latex. Is there any workaround for this issue in 0.12? Thanks!

posts.name: Kevio
posts.cooked: Just wrapping them in a #box should prevent the abbreviation from being broken across lines, I think. You can automate this with show rules like show "e.g.": box
posts.raw: Just wrapping them in a `#box` should prevent the abbreviation from being broken across lines, I think. You can automate this with show rules like `show "e.g.": box`

posts.name: Michael Yang
posts.cooked: Indeed that makes sure it doesn’t break across lines; however, they are still treated as essentially two sentences so the large spaces in between and after. Ideally, “e.g.” should be seen as a single word.
posts.raw: Indeed that makes sure it doesn't break across lines; however, they are still treated as essentially two sentences so the large spaces in between and after. Ideally, "e.g." should be seen as a single word.
